subject: Medicine
title: The Brain Stem
description: A quick win: understand The Brain Stem.

hook.text: You never think about breathing or keeping your heart beating. Your brain stem handles it all automatically.

buildup.text: The brain stem sits at the base of the brain, connecting it to the spinal cord. It controls vital functions.

discovery.text: It regulates heartbeat, breathing, blood pressure, swallowing, and sleep-wake cycles without conscious effort.

twist.text: The brain stem is evolutionarily ancientâ€”reptiles have one too. It's the part of your brain that keeps you alive.

climax.text: Damage to the brain stem is often fatal because it controls the functions essential for survival.

punchline.text: Your oldest brain part does the most vital job.

quiz.question: What makes brain stem damage especially dangerous?
options: It controls vital functions like heartbeat and breathing
